The first and primary test of strategy is, “Will it beat the market?” How does a business really know if it is beating the market?
pb-mcq.pb-choice: It is beating the next best competitor
Value is flowing to the business
pb-mcq.pb-tip:
Not quite. “Beating the market” refers not simply to beating the next best competitor, or to being profitable, but rather to beating market forces in the fullest sense. The goal of strategy is to claim more of the economic value flowing through your sector.

What does it mean to ensure your strategy “taps the true source of advantage?” (Select all that apply.)
pb-mcq.pb-choice: You understand why your business makes money
You have identified your positional advantages (if any)
You have identified your proprietary advantages (if any)
pb-mcq.pb-tip:
This answer choice should be selected.

Tapping your true source of advantage means identifying the real source of sustainable competitive advantage that can drive differential performance.

This answer choice should be selected.

One type of sustainable advantage to consider is positional advantage—any advantages derived from the attractiveness of your industry and your position within it.

Responding to trends is a critical part of strategic work. Which characteristic is most often exhibited by top performing companies?
pb-mrq.pb-choice: Top performing companies stay ahead of the trend
Top performing companies are strong enough to turn back the tide of a trend
Top performing companies are able to operate independently of trends
pb-mrq.pb-tip:
That’s right! Much of the work of strategy is to “see the writing on the wall and act on it.” In other words, top performing companies are those that recognize trends and build a strategy for the future environment—essentially riding the “wave” of a trend.

pb-mrq.pb-choice: Uncertainty is taken out of the equation
pb-mrq.pb-tip:
This answer choice should not be selected.

It’s not possible to eliminate uncertainty. A shrewd strategist resolves the uncertainties that can be, and then acknowledges and characterizes the uncertainties that remain.

This answer choice should be selected.

Strategy is not simply a statement of intent. The rubber hits the road when people, money, and time are shifted to accomplish its goals.
